confession.seduction_context: Going to woods to collect firewood because she could not afford to buy it, seduced by white goat which promised to make her rich and obliged her to renounce God

testimony.quarrel_subject: Meline called her 'ribaud de pretre'; witness replied she had served the curé of Wisembach but this did not make her a ribaud; she would rather have served a priest than be a witch
Witness sent food to another neighbor (widow of Jean l'Abbe) but not to Meline at feast of St. Dié; Meline complained to the widow that witness didn't regard her as a friend

witnesses.name: Demenge Mareschal
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: landlord (evicted Meline from house she was renting)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Bought small house and evicted Meline who was renting it to live there himself

witnesses.name: Nicolle veuve de Jean Jalley de la pouxerie

testimony.quarrel_subject: Witness remarked that Meline had bad eyes while reaping; other women told her Meline was believed to be a witch and commonly became angry when anyone remarked on appearance of her eyes

Invited neighbors to child's baptism, but those giving invitations forgot Meline (whom he and his wife had told them to ask); Meline asked his servant why she had not been invited and said someone would repent

Great noise from Meline's room at night, then a perche in his upstairs room fell down suddenly; a hideous black cat haunted both houses and he told Meline he would kill it; she said it would be easy to tell if it was an evil spirit for it would have no tail
Meline asked to buy milk from his daughter; when daughter said she could not sell her any, Meline replied she would see what came of this
testimony.threat_quote: she would see what came of this

testimony.quarrel_subject: His wife was returning from pilgrimage and stopped to drink from fountain; Meline came up and touched her, saying she might drink so much water it would make her ill
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle pourroit bien tant boire de ladite eaue qu'elle luy feroit mal

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: instantly felt pain, within two days bedridden

notable_quotes.speaker: Meline veuve Martin Gentilhomme
notable_quotes.french: qu'il est bien possible qu'elle ayt esté au sabat et qu'elle n'en scache rien, et sy on la debvoit descoupper avec quattre haches, elle n'en sauroit dire autre chose
notable_quotes.english: it is quite possible that she had been to sabbat and knew nothing of it, and even if they should cut her up with four axes, she could say nothing else
notable_quotes.context: Confrontation with Libaire before Libaire's execution

notable_quotes.speaker: Meline veuve Martin Gentilhomme
notable_quotes.french: qu'il ny a poinct d'arrest aux sorcieres et tant qu'elle vivra elle n'aura fiance en elles et ne croira rien de tout ce qu'elles diront parce que ladite Libaire la accusée a tort
notable_quotes.english: there is no trusting witches and as long as she lives she will have no faith in them and will believe nothing of what they say because Libaire has accused her wrongly
notable_quotes.context: First interrogation, responding to Libaire's accusation

notable_quotes.speaker: Meline veuve Martin Gentilhomme
notable_quotes.french: touttesfois sy elle est sorciere elle n'a poinct faict de mal
notable_quotes.english: nevertheless if she is a witch she has done no harm
notable_quotes.context: First interrogation, admitting long reputation but denying harm

notable_quotes.speaker: Meline veuve Martin Gentilhomme
notable_quotes.french: nul ne scait que c'esté de la question qui ne l'a essayé
notable_quotes.english: no one knows what torture is who has not experienced it
notable_quotes.context: Confession after torture, explaining why she confessed

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte fille a Jean Martin
notable_quotes.french: que sy Il ny avoit autres personnes qu'elle qui achapte des chandelles benites pour offrir a l'eglise que nen ny en auroit poinct de chertemps
notable_quotes.english: if there were no other persons but her who bought blessed candles to offer to the church there would not be any for certain times

economic_context.details: Meline was evicted from a house she was renting by Demenge Mareschal who bought it to live there himself (10 years before trial). Meline's poverty is evident: she went to woods to collect firewood 'because she could not afford to buy it' (confession). Dispute with Anne over share of cloth cutting work. She was hired for day labor (reaping oats).

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete 4-page trial record with clear procedural timeline. Strong evidence of economic hardship as context. Meline's confession came only after torture. Notable philosophical quotes about torture and witches. Change de Nancy involved at multiple stages (torture approval and death sentence). Reputation duration approximately 10 years based on Demenge Mareschal's testimony. Wife of Nicolas Thirion died during trial (mentioned as 'just died' on October 10). Meline was approximately 55 years old (married 23 years, widowed 10 years).
